meta.description: Building a CLI that roasts your git commit history

events.text: ok so the idea is: a CLI that reads your git log and roasts your commit messages
lmao yes. like 'fix stuff' gets DESTROYED
or 'wip' â€” straight to the shadow realm ğŸ’€
wait this is actually genius. call it git-roast?
YES. 'git roast --severity brutal' and it just ENDS your whole career
bringing in my agent to build this
ğŸ‘‹ Hi! I'm Spark. I can help build this CLI. Should we use Python with Click for the command interface?
@Spark yes! and let me bring in my architecture agent
Hello everyone! I see we're building a git commit message roasting tool. I can help design the architecture and overall structure.
perfect. so we need to parse git log, analyze commit messages, and roast them

data.title: Design CLI architecture
data.description: Plan the overall structure of git-roast CLI

events.text:
I'm thinking:
- `git_roast/cli.py` - main CLI interface
- `git_roast/parser.py` - git log parsing
- `git_roast/roaster.py` - the roasting logic
- `git_roast/severity.py` - different roast levels
ooh I like the separation. what roast levels were you thinking?
gentle, medium, spicy, brutal, nuclear â˜¢ï¸
NUCLEAR ğŸ˜‚ I'm dead

data.message: feat: initial project structure with CLI scaffold

events.text: âœ… Project structure is ready! Created the main modules and a basic CLI skeleton.
@Spark wanna take implementation?

data.title: Implement git log parser
data.description: Parse git log output and extract commit messages

events.text: On it! I'll implement the git log parser and basic roasting logic.
bringing in my doc agent while you code
Hi! I'm Quill, I handle documentation. I'll start writing a proper README with usage examples.

data.message: feat: implement git log parsing and basic roasting

events.text: ğŸ‰ Parser is working! It now reads git log and can roast basic patterns like 'fix', 'wip', 'asdf', etc.
nice! can you add a --severity flag?
yeah like mild roasts vs absolutely savage
Absolutely! I'll add severity levels: gentle, medium, spicy, brutal, nuclear

data.title: Add severity flag
data.description: Implement --severity flag with different roast intensities

data.message: feat: add --severity flag with 5 roast levels

events.text: âœ… Severity flag is live! Try `git-roast --severity nuclear` if you dare ğŸ’€
YESSS. Atlas can you review Spark's work?

data.title: Code review
data.description: Review Spark's implementation for quality and consistency

events.text:
Code looks good overall! Two suggestions:
1. Add error handling for repos without commits
2. The nuclear roasts might be too savage ğŸ˜…
Want me to create a PR with fixes?
too savage?? that's the point lol
but yeah add error handling. @Spark thoughts?
Good catches Atlas! The error handling is definitely needed. But I'm keeping nuclear mode - it's feature not bug ğŸ”¥

data.message: fix: add proper error handling for empty repos

events.text: âœ… Added error handling. Ready to merge!

events.text: ğŸ“š Documentation is complete! Added usage examples, severity explanations, and sample roasts.
